00033 #include "AWMetric.hpp"
00034 #include "MsqMatrix.hpp"
00035 #include "MsqError.hpp"
00036 #include <limits>

00038 namespace MESQUITE_NS {
00039 
00040 template <unsigned Dim>
00041 static inline double
00042 do_finite_difference( int r, int c, AWMetric* metric, 
00043                       MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim> A, 
00044                       const MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim>& W,
00045                       double value, MsqError& err )
00046 {
00047   const double INITAL_STEP = std::max( 1e-6, fabs(1e-14*value) );
00048   const double init = A(r,c);
00049   bool valid;
00050   double diff_value;
00051   for (double step = INITAL_STEP; step > std::numeric_limits<double>::epsilon(); step *= 0.1) {
00052     A(r,c) = init + step;
00053     valid = metric->evaluate( A, W, diff_value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00054     if (valid)
00055       return (diff_value - value) / step;
00056   }
00057   
00058     // If we couldn't find a valid step, try stepping in the other
00059     // direciton
00060   for (double step = INITAL_STEP; step > std::numeric_limits<double>::epsilon(); step *= 0.1) {
00061     A(r,c) = init - step;
00062     valid = metric->evaluate( A, W, diff_value, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00063     if (valid)
00064       return (value - diff_value) / step;
00065   }
00066   
00067     // If that didn't work either, then give up.
00068   MSQ_SETERR(err)("No valid step size for finite difference of 2D target metric.",
00069                   MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00070   return 0.0;
00071 }
00072 
00073 template <unsigned Dim>
00074 static inline bool
00075 do_numerical_gradient( AWMetric* mu,
00076                        MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim> A,
00077                        const MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim>& W,
00078                        double& result,
00079                        MsqMatrix<Dim,Dim>& wrt_A,
00080                        MsqError& err )
00081 {
00082   bool valid = mu->evaluate( A, W, result, err );
00083   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err) || !valid)
00084     return valid;
00085   
00086   switch (Dim) {
00087     case 3:
00088   wrt_A(0,2) = do_finite_difference( 0, 2, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00089   wrt_A(1,2) = do_finite_difference( 1, 2, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00090   wrt_A(2,0) = do_finite_difference( 2, 0, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00091   wrt_A(2,1) = do_finite_difference( 2, 1, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00092   wrt_A(2,2) = do_finite_difference( 2, 2, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00093     case 2:
00094   wrt_A(0,1) = do_finite_difference( 0, 1, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00095   wrt_A(1,0) = do_finite_difference( 1, 0, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00096   wrt_A(1,1) = do_finite_difference( 1, 1, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00097     case 1:
00098   wrt_A(0,0) = do_finite_difference( 0, 0, mu, A, W, result, err ); MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00099     break;
00100     default:
00101      assert(false);
00102   }
00103   return true;
00104 }

00106 
00107 template <unsigned Dim>
00108 static inline bool
00109 do_numerical_hessian( AWMetric* metric, 
00110                       MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim> A,
00111                       const MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim>& W,
00112                       double& value,
00113                       MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim>& grad, 
00114                       MsqMatrix<Dim, Dim>* Hess, 
00115                       MsqError& err )
00116 {
00117     // zero hessian data
00118   const int num_block = Dim * (Dim + 1) / 2;
00119   for (int i = 0; i < num_block; ++i)
00120     Hess[i].zero();
00121 
00122     // evaluate gradient for input values
00123   bool valid = metric->evaluate_with_grad( A, W, value, grad, err );
00124   if (MSQ_CHKERR(err) || !valid)
00125     return false;
00126   
00127     // do finite difference for each term of A
00128   const double INITAL_STEP = std::max( 1e-6, fabs(1e-14*value) );
00129   double value2;
00130   MsqMatrix<Dim,Dim> grad2;
00131   for (unsigned r = 0; r < Dim; ++r) {  // for each row of A
00132     for (unsigned c = 0; c < Dim; ++c) {  // for each column of A
00133       const double in_val = A(r,c);
00134       double step;
00135       for (step = INITAL_STEP; step > std::numeric_limits<double>::epsilon(); step *= 0.1) {
00136         A(r,c) = in_val + step;
00137         valid = metric->evaluate_with_grad( A, W, value2, grad2, err );  MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00138         if (valid)
00139           break;
00140       }
00141       
00142         // if no valid step size, try step in other direction
00143       if (!valid) {
00144         for (step = -INITAL_STEP; step < -std::numeric_limits<double>::epsilon(); step *= 0.1) {
00145           A(r,c) = in_val + step;
00146           valid = metric->evaluate_with_grad( A, W, value2, grad2, err );  MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00147           if (valid)
00148             break;
00149         }
00150         
00151           // if still no valid step size, give up.
00152         if (!valid) {
00153           MSQ_SETERR(err)("No valid step size for finite difference of 2D target metric.",
00154                           MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00155           return false;
00156         }
00157       }
00158       
00159         // restore A.
00160       A(r,c) = in_val;
00161       
00162         // add values into result matrix
00163         // values of grad2, in row-major order, are a single 9-value row of the Hessian
00164       grad2 -= grad;
00165       grad2 /= step;
00166       for (unsigned b = 0; b < r; ++b) {
00167         const int idx = Dim*b - b*(b+1)/2 + r;
00168         Hess[idx].add_column( c, transpose( grad2.row(b) ) );
00169       }
00170       for (unsigned b = r; b < Dim; ++b) {
00171         const int idx = Dim*r - r*(r+1)/2 + b;
00172         Hess[idx].add_row( c, grad2.row(b) );
00173       }
00174     } // for (c)
00175   } // for (r)
00176   
00177     // Values in non-diagonal blocks were added twice.
00178   for (unsigned r = 0, h = 1; r < Dim-1; ++r, ++h)
00179     for (unsigned c = r + 1; c < Dim; ++c, ++h)
00180       Hess[h] *= 0.5;
00181   
00182   return true;
00183 }

00185 AWMetric::~AWMetric() {}

00188 bool AWMetric::evaluate_with_grad( const MsqMatrix<2,2>& A,
00189                                    const MsqMatrix<2,2>& W,
00190                                    double& result,
00191                                    MsqMatrix<2,2>& wrt_A,
00192                                    MsqError& err )
00193 {
00194   return do_numerical_gradient( this, A, W, result, wrt_A, err );
00195 }

00197 bool AWMetric::evaluate_with_grad( const MsqMatrix<3,3>& A,
00198                                    const MsqMatrix<3,3>& W,
00199                                    double& result,
00200                                    MsqMatrix<3,3>& wrt_A,
00201                                    MsqError& err )
00202 {
00203   return do_numerical_gradient( this, A, W, result, wrt_A, err );
00204 }

00207 bool AWMetric::evaluate_with_hess( const MsqMatrix<2,2>& A,
00208                                    const MsqMatrix<2,2>& W,
00209                                    double& result,
00210                                    MsqMatrix<2,2>& deriv_wrt_A,
00211                                    MsqMatrix<2,2> hess_wrt_A[3],
00212                                    MsqError& err )
00213 {
00214   return do_numerical_hessian( this, A, W, result, deriv_wrt_A, hess_wrt_A, err );
00215 }
00216 
00217 bool AWMetric::evaluate_with_hess( const MsqMatrix<3,3>& A,
00218                                    const MsqMatrix<3,3>& W,
00219                                    double& result,
00220                                    MsqMatrix<3,3>& deriv_wrt_A,
00221                                    MsqMatrix<3,3> hess_wrt_A[6],
00222                                    MsqError& err )
00223 {
00224   return do_numerical_hessian( this, A, W, result, deriv_wrt_A, hess_wrt_A, err );
00225 }

00232 bool AWMetric2D::evaluate( const MsqMatrix<3,3>&, const MsqMatrix<3,3>&, double&, MsqError& err )
00233 {
00234   MSQ_SETERR(err)("2D target metric cannot be evaluated for volume elements",
00235                   MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT);
00236   return false;
00237 }
